definition: sky lantern (miniature hot-air balloon used during festivals)

sentences.english: Let the sky lanterns shine, to illuminate the future, shine with great splendor, blessing the world.
sentences.chinese: 让天灯普照大地，照亮未来，光辉灿烂，降福人间。

sentences.english: People release sky lanterns to celebrate the Lantern Festival in Pingsi District, New Taipei City on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 民众上周六在新北市平溪区平溪国中施放天灯庆元宵。

sentences.english: Most vendors offer only 90-day warranties on lamps.
sentences.chinese: 大多数厂商只提供90天灯的保证。

sentences.english: Zheng Jia wants will arrogant place with " every days of bit lamp " the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 郑家要将牛儿处以“点天灯”的极刑。

sentences.english: Ep575 - WaWa accompanies Jinsheng for a stroll along the beach. They later release sky lanterns and make wishes.
sentences.chinese: 娃娃陪伴金生到岸边散步，二人更放天灯许愿。

sentences.english: The naked eye can see the lantern floating time to25 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 肉眼所能看到天灯飘浮的时间大至在25分钟。

sentences.english: How can sky lantern fly high up in the sky?
sentences.chinese: 天灯为什么可以飞到天上去？

sentences.english: Did they set them off as a signal to attack?
sentences.chinese: 放天灯表示进攻的信号吗？

sentences.english: Write what you wish on the Sky Lantern.
sentences.chinese: 把你们的愿望写在天灯上。

definition: sky lantern (miniature hot-air balloon used during festivals)
the Lantern Festival (15th of first month of lunar calendar)
fire and candles/household things that burn
altar lamp burning day and night
Ghost Festival on 15th day of 7th lunar month when offerings are made to the deceased
